programme.title: Meet The Orangutans
programme.desc: Theres a baby boom at the sanctuary as new arrivals mix with news of more on the way. The dominant male known as C.I.D is thought to be father of all offspring, but perhaps not?

programme.title: Sharks Vs Dolphins: Face Off
programme.desc: Sharks and dolphins have shared the ocean for ages, but only recently, scientists have begun to understand the true nature of the relationship between these two masters of the sea.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Follow stray pups in Thailand through the first weeks of their dangerous lives. And in Kathmandu, dogs are worshipped and dressed with garlands for the Tihar festival.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Wolfpack races to complete the first major build of their new ranch. Plus, the Brown family adds a new member as Noah marries his sweetheart Rhain.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Wolfpacks quest for complete freedom takes a big step forward with new livestock, including a risky longhorn bull. Noah and his new wife Rhain arrive.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Experts reveal how swarms of blind bats avoid collision. Do mice really like cheese? What makes manatees farts so special? And, why are slugs so slimy?

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: How humpback whales are able to leap so far out of the water, why dogs tilt their heads and how do spiders shed their own skin. Plus, why do animals gather in swarms?.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: A mission becomes personal when Miamis animal cruelty investigators find two adopted dogs wandering the city streets in need of help.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Theres heartbreak as investigator Labrada fights to save a poorly dog thats been rejected by its owners. Plus, a young girl rescues a horse left without food or water.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Investigators brave alligator-infested waters to help save an injured alligator. Meanwhile, 400 farm animals are rescued in Miamis biggest ever seizure!

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: Graduation is around the corner but intense rotations are still ahead - they must show no weakness on the road to becoming qualified veterinarians.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: Bradley and Billy are in the Mojave Desert, California, to find the bombardier beetle. When attacked or agitated, it releases a hot, noxious chemical spray.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: In the Madagascan rainforest, the team search for a nearly invisible creature: the panther chameleon. When tested, the reptile seems to defy the laws of physics.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: When a black lab swallows some toxic metal, Dr. Jeff races to save his life. Then, a cat suddenly returns home after a year and a half with a mysterious injury, and a tiny dog has a big life-threatening problem.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff and the team head to Mexico to offer free veterinary care for poor families. Over one gruelling week they will treat hundreds of animals in need.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert handles a hostile wombat called Bunker, and its moving day for a giant anaconda called Nikki. Terri helps treat hundreds of lorikeets injured by a hailstorm.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri responds when wallaby Daniel is severely injured and cannot walk. Robert and Chandler catch some waves before going to pick up a new Komodo dragon.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade travels to Alaska to investigate the disappearance of the king salmon. His search will take him through grizzly bear territory, remote native communities and the Pacific Ocean as he follows a trail of evidence.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Lizzy and Elise struggle to rescue a dangerously dehydrated dog. An abandoned and anxious dog is moved to a new warehouse for dogs with special needs.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson helps a couple afraid to have a child due to their hostile cat, Martini. And can he keep the peace between cats Tana and Buddha, who fight around the kitty litter?

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: A familys two Nigerian dwarf goats wreak havoc in their backyard! So, designer Antonio transforms it into a fun goat playground, including a climbing tower.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Firefighter Ricky rescued a Burmese python from a burning building. In one of his biggest projects Antonio transforms a basement into an epic snake habitat.

programme.title: Extinct Or Alive
programme.desc: Madagascars Pachylemurs were red, furry giants, nearly the size of great apes. Forrest scales the jungle canopy to prove the giant species still lives.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Rapper 2 Chainz enlists the ATM crew for an Atlanta-themed aquarium; the team promises him a super-sized tank, but Wayde loses some important measurements; behind-the-scenes extras.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: World champion boxer, Fernando Vargas, asks ATM to make a boxing glove-shaped tank for his boxing gym in Las Vegas. Can they deliver a knockout?

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Howie Mandel wants ATM to build another tank! This time its a surprise for his managers company - and their an existing tank needs a major upgrade.

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: Following four groups of ordinary people as they travel into the wilderness of Alaska, where they must find a new home in the inhospitable environment and deal with the threat posed by bears, glaciers and their own fears.

programme.title: Animal ER
programme.desc: Oorla, an Alaskan Malamute is brought into the hospital after having a cancerous lump removed. But when vets find the cancer has spread, can a course of radiotherapy cure her?

programme.title: Saved By The Barn

programme.title: Bad Dog

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Wolfpack seizes an opportunity to stockpile meat with their first-ever buffalo hunt. Brothers Noah and Bam are left to build a mine-cooled meat locker and keep the ranch running in anticipation of the familys return.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People

programme.title: Beautiful Men
programme.desc: Trois frères chauves se rendent à Istanbul pour subir une greffe de cheveux. Un tendre court metrage danimation.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Aujourdhui, le feu est devenu synonyme de destruction, avec des incendies de plus en plus ravageurs emettant denormes quantites de CO2. De quoi accelerer le derèglement climatique qui, à son tour, favorise les departs de feu. Un cercle vicieux qui a pousse les chercheurs à qualifier notre epoque de "pyrocène".

programme.title: Faire lhistoire
programme.desc: Comment et pourquoi une maison en bois, venue des alpages suisses a conquis le monde ? Des banlieues des villes aux lotissements balneaires, on ne compte plus les declinaisons du style de cet habitat "en kit". Manuel Charpy, historien des cultures materielles, explique en quoi le chalet, mondialise au XIXe siècle, est devenu le fruit de la standardisation industrielle et de la circulation planetaire des materiaux.

programme.title: Faire lhistoire
programme.desc: Le crucifix, bien avant d’etre un objet protecteur porte par les fidèles, fut au Moyen Âge un lieu de convergence entre un symbole theologique (la croix) et la representation, de plus en plus realiste, du corps souffrant du Sauveur. Valerie Theis, historienne du Moyen Âge, raconte la lente genèse de ce talisman chretien.

programme.title: Faire lhistoire
programme.desc: Decouverte en 1894 à Brassempouy (Landes) par larcheologue et prehistorien Édouard Piette, cette petite sculpture est datee de plus de 23 000 ans avant notre ère. Elle donne un visage aux personnes de la prehistoire et nous oblige à changer le regard que l’on peut porter sur elles. Larcheologue François Bon explique pourquoi cet objet suscite autant de questionnements.

programme.title: Les clans sauvages du parc de Katavi
programme.desc: Au parc national de Katavi, en Tanzanie, un cycle climatique inhabituel a transforme la saison sèche naturelle en la periode de secheresse la plus dure jamais vue depuis des decennies ; mais la pluie finit par arriver. La rivière Katuma sort de son lit, et le pays se trouve inonde par des masses deau torrentielles qui mettent en danger les animaux du parc.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Pauvrete, catastrophes environnementales, conflits armes… La presse et les reseaux sociaux donnent souvent l’impression que tout va mal. Mais ce sombre tableau reflète-t-il la realite ? Que disent les chiffres et les statistiques ? Comment mesurer l’etat du monde ? Et meme en possedant toutes ces donnees, savons-nous vraiment si le meilleur appartient au passe ou s’il reste encore à venir ?

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Les cryptomonnaies divisent les esprits : si les economistes mettent en garde contre les risques d’une bulle, les adeptes du bitcoin voient là une revolution. Alors que les cryptomonnaies pourraient etre un moyen pour les Russes de contourner les sanctions occidentales mises en place suite à linvasion de lUkraine, gros plan sur ce système monetaire alternatif.

programme.title: Le genie cache des plantes
programme.desc: Les scientifiques ont recemment mis en lumière des sens et des strategies de survie insoupçonnes des plantes. Au plus près des recherches en cours, ce documentaire en deux parties porte un regard nouveau sur l’intimite du monde vegetal.

programme.title: Le genie cache des plantes
programme.desc: Sedentaires, et donc incapables de fuir le danger, les plantes revèlent dans la lutte pour leur survie des strategies sophistiquees. Elles peuvent ainsi deployer des armes chimiques en cas d’attaque, nouer des alliances avec une multitude d’espèces et en manipuler d’autres.

programme.title: ARTE Junior, le mag
programme.desc: Grâce à laide de nombreux benevoles, les personnes en fauteuil roulant peuvent profiter de la vue depuis la plus haute dune dEurope.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: La musique peut nous rendre euphoriques ou melancoliques. Meme les nourrissons se mettent à fretiller au rythme d’une comptine. Alors, quels mecanismes sont à l’œuvre quand nous eprouvons l’envie irrepressible de nous tremousser ? Longtemps cantonnee à la philosophie, cette question est desormais etudiee par les scientifiques, qui observent les neurones des musiciens et melomanes par imagerie cerebrale.

programme.title: Construire des visions
programme.desc: Cap sur des concepts architecturaux novateurs et hautement adaptables. Cet episode explore le nord du Chili, où des architectes misent sur des espaces dedies aux enfants, des stations depuration et des zones ombragees pour aider les populations defavorisees les plus exposees aux fortes chaleurs.

programme.title: Twist
programme.desc: Moment de convivialite, de partage culturel et de creativite, cuisiner est aussi une tâche quotidienne fatigante et chronophage, trop souvent deleguee aux femmes. Dans ce numero, "Twist" part aux quatre coins de l’Europe à la rencontre de professionnels et s’interroge : la cuisine, plaisir ou corvee ?

programme.title: Chanter la vie : les Manouches d’Alsace
programme.desc: En Alsace, Tosca et Maya font partie de la communaute manouche. La première, âgee de 18 ans, est elève au conservatoire de Strasbourg et croise les traditions musicales tsiganes et sa passion pour lopera. Sa cousine Maya, la trentaine, est aveugle depuis ladolescence. Accordeuse de piano, elle dirige une chorale qui mele voyants et non-voyants, et a cree la première equipe feminine de cecifoot.

programme.title: Les delices d’Émilie-Romagne
programme.desc: Un delicieux voyage à la croisee des traditions culinaires du nord de lItalie. Cet episode nous emmène à Parme et dans louest de lÉmilie-Romagne, où se deploie une grande diversite de paysages, dont la celèbre plaine du Pô. Au menu : des tagliatelles issues de varietes anciennes de cereales, du parmesan au lait de vache rousse et le gâteau rouge de Langhirano.

programme.title: Mont-Saint-Michel, le labyrinthe de l’archange
programme.desc: Perdu entre la Bretagne et la Normandie, le Mont-Saint-Michel attire chaque annee plusieurs millions de visiteurs. À la faveur dun chantier de restauration, historiens et archeologues lèvent le voile sur les mystères architecturaux de ce monument iconique, qui na cesse de se reconstruire au cours de treize siècles dhistoire tumultueuse.

programme.title: Quand lhistoire fait dates
programme.desc: En l’an 800, le jour de Noël, Charlemagne se fait couronner empereur dans la basilique Saint-Pierre de Rome par le pape Leon III. L’evenement est retentissant : dans les livres d’histoire, il marque non pas un commencement mais un recommencement, et meme une renaissance. Mais l’evenement est plus complexe qu’il n’y paraît…

programme.title: Cartouche
programme.desc: À Paris, sous la Regence, Louis-Dominique Bourguignon, alias Cartouche, fait partie des "Coquillards", une bande de voleurs chapeautee par le tyrannique Malichot. Dans le but de sen affranchir, Cartouche sengage dans larmee... Laventure ne fait que commencer.

programme.title: Claudia Cardinale, la creature du secret
programme.desc: Comment une jeune Tunisoise sauvage et garçon manque devint sans le vouloir une grande actrice. Claudia Cardinale ou le destin follement romanesque dune star paradoxale, qui a notamment tourne avec Federico Fellini, Luchino Visconti, Blake Edwards et Sergio Leone.

programme.title: Memoires de volcans
programme.desc: Sils sont à lorigine de cataclysmes, les volcans sont aussi lun des moteurs essentiels de levolution des espèces. Ce documentaire raconte la vie de lun deux, sur plus de 60 millions dannees, à laide dimages spectaculaires.

programme.title: Georges de La Tour, peindre la condition humaine
programme.desc: Peintre français à la personnalite trouble, relegue dans lombre durant des siècles, Georges de La Tour (1593-1652) a eu à coeur de representer les oublies de son temps. En marge d’une exposition au musee Jacquemart-Andre, ce documentaire eclaire le chemin d’un artiste aussi illustre qu’enigmatique.

programme.title: Concert au château de Prague 2025
programme.desc: Pour son traditionnel concert de clôture de saison en plein air, qui se tient sur la place Hradcany, au pied du château de Prague, l’Orchestre philharmonique tchèque, sous la baguette de la Finlando-Ukrainienne Dalia Stasevska, interprète Leos Janacek, Lili Boulanger, Georges Bizet et Maurice Ravel.

programme.title: Karambolage
programme.desc: Lena Gutfreund est allemande. Elle nous presente une bouteille d’eau allemande très chic / Le 9 octobre 2025, l’ancien resistant et ministre de la Justice Robert Badinter entrera au Pantheon. Retour sur le combat de sa vie, l’abolition de la peine de mort en France.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: Simone Signoret, figure libre
programme.desc: Un emouvant documentaire qui retrace la carrière dune actrice dont la vie fut marquee par lengagement.

programme.title: Prisoners
programme.desc: Deux fillettes de 6 ans ont disparu en Pennsylvanie. Persuade que le policier en charge de l’affaire a bâcle lenquete, un des deux pères decide de faire justice lui-meme. Il enlève et torture lhomme quil croit responsable de la disparition de sa fille et de la meilleure amie de celle-ci...

programme.title: Frenzy
programme.desc: Un insaisissable "tueur à la cravate" defraye la chronique londonienne.

programme.title: Berlioz : La damnation de Faust
programme.desc: Dans le somptueux cadre Art deco du Theâtre des Champs-Élysees, l’Orchestre national de France interprète l’un des chefs-d’œuvre du romantisme français avec un casting vocal de haute volee : Stephanie d’Oustrac, John Irvin, Paul Gay, Frederic Caton.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants face three tasks involving sweet dough and begin by making signature tea loaves, presenting judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood with everything from a Devonshire-inspired panettone to Welsh bara brith. They also face one of Pauls most fiendish technical challenges yet and must create 36 sweet European buns in the showstopper round. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With only six bakers left in the tent, the stakes increase as they face the pastry round. The remaining bakers bring the old fashioned suet pudding bang up to date.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the quarter-final and Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood test how the five remaining contestants cope with unconventional flours and unusual desserts, beginning by baking a signature loaf using non-traditional flours such as spelt, rye, potato and tapioca. In the technical challenge they each have to prepare a gluten-free dacquoise, which is made with meringue, coffee custard and hazelnut praline, before creating dairy-free novelty vegetable cakes for the showstopper round. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A horse-trekking expedition is cut short when Jack discovers the dead body of a rider in the most unexpected of places: the police station itself.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Locals on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie make plans to celebrate the New Year - only for the festivities to be cut short when a masked man stabs a woman in her own home, providing Detective Inspector Jack Mooney and his team with yet another murder to solve.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Jack Mooney and the team are called to a workshop where acclaimed artist Donna Harman has been found dead. Suspicion immediately falls on the three people closest to the crime scene, but with no one entering the workshop between the time the victim returned to start on her next painting and being found dead, the scene paints a tricky picture. Only a solitary drink can seems to hold the answer, but matters are complicated when Donnas art dealer and an art collector enter the fray. Meanwhile, Jack is confused by his blossoming feelings for Anna. Whodunit, starring Ardal OHanlon, with Nina Wadia, Barbara Flynn, Louise Brealey and Vivienne Acheampong

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti

Tom is now servant to Lord Jerry, and the Master wastes no time in making Toms life miserable. Tom is caught in the act of exacting revenge, so Lord Jerry challenges Tom to a duel in the dream world.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry is feeling lonely and wishes he had a girlfriend. Spike explains spring fever to Tom and they leave him be. Jerrys mood improves when he gets a message from his brawny cousin Muscles, who has fixed him up with his girlfriends friend for a double date.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Jerrys country cousins visit the Abbey, the cook is convinced Downton is in the midst of a vermin invasion! Cates (the butler) presses Tom into service with the threat of becoming a stable cat otherwise. Tom pursues the cunning, feisty bumpkins, and Jerry, throughout the manor, and they delight in making surprise appearances to Tom in awkward moments.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry discovers the mysterious phobia cats have toward cucumbers and is inspired to try it out on Tom. After freaking Tom out repeatedly, Butch steps in to counsel Tom and help him overcome his fear, only Butch is far from immune himself. The two encounter more and more trouble as they deal with their phobia.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean takes Billy to a climbing centre and gets drawn into a challenge.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at a farmers’ market with Irma at her knitwear stall – right next to a man selling novelty teapots. Bean is instantly smitten with a green car-shaped one but can’t afford it. When he visits a food truck that’s laid out free samples, he hatches a plan to swipe them and sell them on his own stall so he can raise the cash for the teapot of his dreams!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Animated antics. Mrs. Wicket thwarts Mr. Beans plans to watch his favourite TV show.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean peers through the window of the opening party of an art exhibition and sees free snacks being handed around – yum! But he’s told by the bouncer that he needs to be smartly dressed. So he sneaks into the artist’s studio and paints a tuxedo onto himself. This time he’s let in, but will Bean’s fake painted suit last long enough for him to get his free food?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Inspired by a wildlife documentary on TV, Mr. Bean dusts off his camera and treks deep into the countryside in search of the perfect wildlife photograph. After two fruitless days of being the hunter, he is somewhat miffed to find himself the hunted.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean discovers that, in the world of organised crime, a teddy isn’t always a teddy. Sometimes it’s a rabbit.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to watch the motor racing on TV, when Mrs Wicket interrupts him to offer a deal – revamp her garden with new paving and ornaments, and he’ll get a month’s rent for free. Bean reluctantly agrees, but when he sees Mr Paliwal finish a personal training session and keen for more, he offers him a new workout… doing all Mr Bean’s work for him while he watches the racing! Win, win!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: In a trampoline park, Bean competes in a race with a boy. The winner gets Teddy. Will Bean and Teddy be separated forever?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Irma is struggling to sell items from her knitwear stall at the market, so sends Mr Bean to collect a sheep costume he can wear to attract customers. Once at the fancy dress shop however, Mr Bean gets stuck in the sheep costume and has to travel back to the market wearing it. Things go from bad to worse when Mr Bean takes a short cut across the field and gets caught up in a flock of real sheep!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys a new Big Ted – but how will he get on with Teddy?

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs will never learn about watching horror movies before bed. He can never sleep afterwards. He jumps at every strange noise - including the ones Skinnys making downstairs, as he blends up a smoothie IN HIS SLEEP. Skinny sleepwalks into trouble all night, and with Specs gibbering in terror, it falls to Lamput to keep the slumbering nerd out of trouble. Apparently you shouldnt wake sleepwalkers. Turning into a rubber band and flinging them at the moon? Thats fine.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput decides to help distressed duck parents find their missing children. But the ducklings are too much for him to handle!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput is stuck in the lab with a dangerous robot on the loose! Its up to the entire Lab team to save him before it is too late.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Easter Bunny is sick, so she hires The Looney Builders to take over the festivities and ensure Looneyburg has a great Easter.

programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by Ma and Pa Bear to build a bedroom for their son, Junior, whose excitement causes setbacks.

programme.desc: An action-packed music video of The Looney Builders traveling across land, air, and sea to get the job done.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: Krypto embarks on a high-flying chase that creates major mayhem for a bus driver on his way to school.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: When a successful video game company tries to convince Velma to work for them in San Francisco the gang becomes embroiled in the mystery of a video game villain.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang goes to Salem, Massachusetts, for the historical festival, only to discover history repeating itself as a demon has been set loose on the town, supposedly summoned by a witch as revenge for the infamous 17th-century Salem witch trials.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean loses a stranger’s engagement ring and has to get it back in time for the proposal!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: When one of the toy cars of his racing track set becomes broken, Mr. Bean decides to buy a new one but since his Mini has a flat tire, he decides to take a taxi. The taxi driver deliberately drives around the town and stops for gas and lunch in the hopes of getting a higher fare. Bean tries to escape, but other passengers mistake Bean as the driver, and Bean reluctantly drives the taxi.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean needs to impress Irma who is infatuated with the hunky deliveryman. Bean tries to improve his physique at the gym but has little success. Instead he opts for an inflatable muscle suit. Irma is indeed impressed and Bean’s plan seems to be working – until the suit gets punctured and Bean makes the mistake of re-inflating it with helium. As Bean floats off into the sky will Irma’s admiration be punctured?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is initially charmed when a seemingly cute seagull turns up on his windowsill. Bean feeds the gull and invites the bird inside. But it’s not long before the seagull in the flat turns out to be a cuckoo in the nest taking over Bean’s home – eating all his food controlling the TV and sleeping in his bed. Bean starts to regret taking on a new best friend in place of good old reliable Teddy.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is stuck in a lift and starts to annoy the other passengers.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: It is a nice sunny day and Mr. Bean and Mrs. Wicket are relaxing in the garden, Mr. Bean attempts to sit beside her in the cool shade of her outdoor umbrella but Mrs. Wicket refuses. He decides to design his own umbrella for himself and Teddy. As he starts digging, he discovers - to his surprise - a bomb. He tries to disarm it, unfortunately, his attempt only accelerates its countdown.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is in a trance – barks like a dog and starts to dance.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.desc: The Kazoom Kid Heroes and the Kazoom Kid Villains face off to gain control of the citys energy.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: When the ghost of a small towns founder returns to scare off mayoral candidates, the gang decides to run Velma as mayor to bait the ghost. They quickly discover however, that Velma lacks the skill set to make her a popular politician.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: “Chasing Lamput” turns out to be the ultimate backstage pass; the Docs pursue the orange blob through the dressing room and directly onto the stage of a gigantic stadium rock concert. The crowd goes wild. Which raises questions about their taste in music, to be honest; Skinny plays guitar like he’s gotten himself tangled in the strings (which he has), and Specs’ drumming, well, it’s certainly got passion. No taste, skill or rhythm, but certainly passion. The stage ends up in tatters by the time the actual band arrives. Those Docs are a hard act to follow.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is furious with the untidy state of the streets and all the people who drop litter so he goes on a one-man mission to clean up the town. Armed with several bin bags Mr Bean collects all the rubbish and puts up his own ‘No Littering’ signs - which have absolutely no effect. When the police show no interest in his campaign Bean builds a homemade vacuuming contraption causing chaos and mayhem wherever he goes.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to deal with an unwanted house guest but the stubborn pest refuses to leave.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean fights a losing battle with a winged beast from Hell.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have laid hand on special magnets which turn any object they are stuck to into flying objects.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: With a lion-tamers whip a sugar bowl and lots of work the Lemmings have successfully trained a caribou to go through their obstacle course.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings think that programming a new electronic lemming toy to dance would be a lot more fun than having it just feed Grizzy snacks.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy finds himself unwillingly caught up in a race between two teams of Lemmings. When he understands the stakes, he tries to win but loses. Grizzy has his pride: he wants a re-match.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have placed giant remote-controlled hydraulic jacks under the cabin to transform it into a life-sized rolling ball game. Grizzy, who in inclined to seasickness, tries to put things back in place. The cabin tips over into empty space.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy is disturbed during his nap by a few uncatchable flies which buzz incessantly around his head. When he realizes that the carnivorous plant upon which the Lemmings are playing rodeo feeds off flying insects, he decides to confiscate it and use it as an anti-fly weapon.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When all of the Batwheels (except for Bam) mysteriously disappear, Bam enlists the help of A.D.A.M, the original Batmobile, to help save his friends. programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Redbird tries his hand at espionage as “V-8, the Super-Spy”, he quickly realizes hes gotten in over his head.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Marvin the Martian hires The Looney Builders to build an outer space ball court on Mars. Bugs is a big fan of the sport, and soon becomes a ball and build “hog.”

programme.desc: Tom accidentally puts a spell on Santa and, as a result of Santas new state, Tom and Jerry volunteer to help Santa deliver gifts. A Christmas miracle occurs when Tom and Jerry sacrifice their own gifts for each other.

programme.desc: Jerry and Tuffy are getting ready to go to a family reunion.

programme.desc: The Lemmings are all lined up on the couch to watch a cartoon film where a mouse plays nasty tricks on a cat. The cat is desperate to find them before the big tournament. Its up to Tom and Jerry to retrace the cats steps and solve this mystery.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ginger and Rick have installed a new birdbath, and Little Quacker has taken up residence in it. Ginger forbids Tom from going out in the back and has Rick move Spikes house. programme.desc: Little Quacker develops the ability to sing like Pavarotti. But when Tom plots to use this to win a prize on the "Pets With Talent" TV show, Little Quacker refuses and Jerry covers for him. As things continue to snowball, its up to Tom to attempt saving the day.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After Ginger keeps an abandoned pet hamster unbeknown to Rick, Jerry takes its place after the hamster scurries off. However, Jerry soon gets displaced by baby hamsters that keep multiplying. Soon the situation is out of control.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy are enjoying a day at the arcade, when Mr Bean gets carried away with the dance machine, knocking Teddy onto the floor. Teddy’s picked up, put on a trolley of stuffed toys and figurines – and soon enough, he’s been put in the claw machine as a prize! Mr Bean has run out of coins, so has to find a way of winning Teddy back without looking like he’s cheating!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy are looking forward to seeing a once-in-a-lifetime comet – but it won’t appear until 4am! He tries to stay up, but it’s useless – he keeps dropping off. So instead, Mr Bean decides to go to bed and set an alarm – yet he over-winds the clock and it breaks! With all the shops closed, his only option is to build his own complicated version to make sure he doesn’t miss the comet…

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean cant find a parking space so he makes one of his own.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean gets a real bug for painting. Then several bugs… and flies and slugs and mice.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket makes Mr Bean drive her to the hospital to get her ingrown toenail seen to and asks him to wait. Mr Bean gets bored, and on a wander around the hospital he finds a spare doctor’s outfit with stethoscope – great Teddy - I’ll give you a check-up! But a nurse spots him, and thinking he’s a new doctor Mr Bean is asked to visit patients. How long can he keep it up before he’s found out?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean makes his own horror movie and ropes in Mrs Wicket as the star!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s goldfish but Scrapper the cat is keen to ‘help’.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean takes Billy to a climbing centre and gets drawn into a challenge.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and the jewel thief have a lot in common. They are both round and blue. Also they both like accelerating into blind corners. A full-speed collision results in an accidental identity mixup - suddenly the thief finds himself with a real job at the Lab, and poor old Specs is being used as bedding by a hulking prison inmate. When Lamput decides to open up a can of kick-butt, the thief starts to wonder if a life of crime might be safer after all. Specs has no doubt at all where hed prefer to be. Lamput unveils a surprising skill at the kung-fu nerve-pinch. Specs is busted out of the clink, and returns to the life he loves: sprinting alongside his best bud Skinny, constantly failing to catch ol Lamput.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: While on holiday, the Docs realize that Lamput is on the same train, but in First Class! They disguise themselves to try and get in.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The carnival is in town! The Docs chase Lamput into the clowns fun house, much to the clowns annoyance, and its no fun for the Docs, too.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When The Looney Builders help Wile E. Coyote build a telescope to view the Looney Moon, Tweety must face his fear of the dark. / The Looney Builders are hired by Mayor Leghorn to build the venue for the Looney Games. They soon become overwhelmed by the job and must ask for help.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Gossamer extends a camping trip invitation to the Looney Builders; their plans for a basic campsite shift when Daffy convinces the group to experience glamping instead.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs tries to play music for the crew on their lunch break, but his “boogie button” is busted.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird is convinced that nobody likes his eccentric dance moves, but its up to the rambunctious rally car to dance his way to victory.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After Nightbike reveals that hes afraid of loud noises, the Batwheels help him overcome his fear so he can stop The Penguin from stealing some valuable cargo.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Fred and the gang are called in to help with a mystery involving a figure from Freds past, Professor Huh? Fred discovers Rose, with whom he learned mystery solving until they had a falling out, has also arrived with her gang.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Fred and the gang are called in to help with a mystery involving a figure from Freds past Professor Huh? Fred discovers Rose his old childhood friend with whom he learned mystery solving until they had a falling out has also arrived with her gang. The race to see which gang could solve the mystery first is on as the rest of the gang learns theres more to this story than meets the eye and Freds interest in finding Professor Huh? is as personal as it gets.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is watering Mr Paliwal’s precious plant while he’s on holiday… what could possibly go wrong?!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean builds a car washing machine that attracts all manner of customers.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is wracked with guilt after he chases Scrapper and ends up with a flattened cat.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean plays gooseberry when Mrs Wicket falls in love with a man Mr Bean doesn’t trust.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean takes trick or treating to the next level in a war with his next-door neighbours!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has painted his room bright green. But will Mrs Wicket approve?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean becomes an accidental wrestling champion – with a little help from two little old ladies.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean takes Billy to a climbing centre and gets drawn into a challenge.

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: Kid Kazoom and Multy have to enter an active volcano to retrieve a new Kazoom fragment.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The Scooby Gang enter Dickens classic ?A Christmas Carol?, as they try to get to the bottom of the mysterious ghost tormenting Scrooge in 1843 England. Unfortunately, the Ghosts begin to convince Velma shes on a disastrous path of her own.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Unhappy about a mystery-free, three-day, cross-country train trip with the gang, Fred is pleasantly surprised to discover a monster mystery on board. Hes less pleasantly surprised however, when that mystery is interrupted by a second mystery, then a third, then a fourth…

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The premiere event on the fashion calendar is about to begin!! The Docs chase Lamput in through the stage door and bring the tone way down. Before you know it everyone’s embarked upon a short and exceedingly painful catwalk career. This season’s colour: orange. The Docs try their hand at lighting design. They suck at that, too. The blue nerds get ejected hard by venue security, and Lamput becomes the hit look of the show. So versatile! So changeable! One size fits all!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is watering Mr Paliwal’s precious plant while he’s on holiday… what could possibly go wrong?!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean tries to be romantic but his idea of romance is very different from his girlfriend’s.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The animated antics of the hapless bumbler Mr Bean. Mr Bean enters a competition to win a trolley of free food!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A leisurely stroll in the park turns into a run when Mr. Bean is chased home by an angry Mime Artist. He is lost for more words than usual when the street performer makes himself at home and insists on being wined and dined. Bean ousts the pest from his house using the only language mime artists understand.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Even for a giant seven foot bear, its not easy getting rid of pesky lemmings but its all fun seeing them constantly try to outsmart each other with cheeky plans

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Exasperated by the Lemmings who prevent him from watching his favorite TV show in peace Grizzy catapults them out of the cabin.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings dont agree about how often the cabins new cuckoo clock should play its song.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Woken with a start by a nightmare filled with Lemmings, Grizzy stumbles on the Rangers dream machine. Its a headphone set where you can program the theme of your choice before falling asleep within seconds for a night filled with sweet dreams. But who could possibly sleep soundly surrounded by Lemmings who want their fair share too?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy happens onto an old American India medallion bearing the symbol of the wind. He who wears it has the power to command air streams. Grizzy would be quite content to never leave the sofa again and control things from a distance, but the Lemmings want it to create fantastic new games that literally blow you away.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A magic Amerindian top modifies the mental age of anyone who watches it spin. From now on Grizzy has the mind of a 10-month old baby.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A magic horn lands on the muzzle of a moose, endowing it with grace and the ability to fly. When Grizzy sees this strange creature, he dreams of taming it as a gift for she-bear while the Lemmings imagine themselves playing rodeo.

programme.title: Moley: Squirm And Manny
programme.desc: Manny wants to play some games, but all Squirm wants to do is paint. Manny decides to take things into his own hands when Squirm refuses to play along.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After refusing to practice with her new underwater mode, Batwing is unable to save Batman from Penguins sunken ship trap.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After agreeing to swap motherboards and change bodies, the Batwheels have to quickly learn to “drive a mile in each other’s wheels” in time to stop the approaching Legion of Zoom!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi has some competition with Nightwing’s motorcycle, Nightbike. These stunt bikes will need to learn that they’re better when they work together.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Ducky and Quizz steal the Bat-Signal’s one-of-a-kind lightbulb, Bam and Batwing must find a way to restore the legendary light.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders build a float to lead the Flower Parade, but Porky won’t settle for anything less than Porky Perfect.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired to build a rollercoaster for Looneyburg. Bugs and Daffy soon get caught up trying to prove their part of the coaster is the best.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Sam Sheepdog hires The Looney Builders to build him a salon. Sam offers his custom cut only to learn that different folks want different styles.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Pro snowboarder Pepper Polar Bear hires The Looney Builders to build a ski resort. Pepper soon learns that others have different skill levels.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Tom and Butch compete to be top cat in the United Mouse Catchers, they must prove their worth by finally catching Jerry. Butch finds out that Jerry is a tough opponent and also finds that living with Spike and Tyke is no piece of cake.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Hildie and Beatie commemorate the passing of their mother, and Tom tries to help out by bringing her back from the grave. But she is so evil that the witches command Tom to make a spell to send her back.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom stars in a documentary that mischaracterizes his daily activities. All of his daily activities, from chasing Jerry to "romancing" Toodles are recorded.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Dr. Bigby invents a transporting machine that accidentally transports Jerry and Tom to Paris where they meet Gigi and Cozette.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: After an exciting race, Ella’s Dad gives her a mysterious Treasure Map of their solar system. It was Slippy’s dad who had given it to him when they were boys. They quickly figure out how to read the map and set off.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella’s family is packing for their Annual Flare Star Day when Madhu asks for Ella’s help. It’s urgent! Madhu’s rock friend Zobu needs her! Ella accepts but she must be quick. Ella rescues Zobu in no time when Slippy calls in on a combubble.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and Tilly’s playtime results in the smashing of precious crystals that are part of Mom’s meticulous experiments. Determined to replace them, Ella battles a pulsar and then a super-hot planet before she realizes her sidelined little sister could be a big help!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy’s excited to try out his new Rocket Boosters. He’s so excited that he overloads them and becomes stranded on a dangerous moon with Madhu. It’s up to Ella to jog Madhu’s memory so they can find the right moon and save Slippy!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: The gang is excited to have all kinds of fun when Maggie dashes each one of their plans with her less-than-fun information. Slippy heads off in a slump but finds an old ship trapped in ice on Triton. He calls Ella and Madhu to come explore!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Hedge tries out Toad’s new power kite and gives the Weasels an idea of how to get into Toad Hall.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its the annual Regatta race, and everyone is determined to win, especially the previous winner, Ratty. But even he has to learn that winning isnt the only goal.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad decides to create his own stylish cologne. But when the weasels ruin it and then occupy his home, is the new stinky cologne the answer to regaining Toad Hall?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its Halloween, and Toad boasts of having a ghost in Toad Hall. His friends go to see if its true, but it turns out to be an elaborate hoax. Or is it?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: The weasels hear of Toad’s fear of scarecrows and use this to frighten Toad out of Toad Hall for good.

programme.title: The World Today

programme.title: Inheritors
programme.desc: Inheritors is a multi-media product from CGTN that shines a light on China’s rich Intangible Cultural Heritage. Each 30-minute TV edition is hosted by a long-term expatriate in China who has a unique understanding of the country’s culture. He or she will introduce viewers to people who are dedicating their lives to its protection, inheritance, innovation, development and promotion.

programme.title: The World Today
programme.desc: The World Today is the core rolling service of CGTN. keep viewers up-to-date with all the worlds top stories as they happen.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: Africa Live
programme.desc: Africa Live is a news program that focuses on African issues and issues related to this diverse continent. CGTNs Nairobi-based broadcast center produces Africa Live.

programme.title: Talk Africa
programme.desc: Talk Africa is a weekly discussion show that brings the most influential voices in Africa to the world.

programme.title: Sports Scene
programme.desc: Sports Scene brings you closer to all the action from all corners of the world, with highlights from across Europe, North America and Chinas top sports leagues.

programme.title: Biz Talk
programme.desc: A groundbreaking 30-minute interview show, giving an in-depth look into how top companies around the world conduct business and how policymakers view the fast-changing world economy. programme.title: Botched: Post Op
programme.desc: Join beauty expert Heather Dubrow and renowned plastic surgeons Terry Dubrow and Paul Nassif as they return to host the second of three after-show specials featuring highlighted cases from the hit medical series Botched. Together, they recap the relevant episode and offer further insights through newly revealed secrets, behind-the-scenes footage, and commentary from the patients themselves. Some surprise celebrity guests offer their perspectives too, while the two esteemed doctors reveal more about the life-changing decisions they had to make in support of the patients in their care. Fans of Botched can learn more about the original operations that caused the patients both heartache and body ache. And they can gain an insight into the emotional journey the patients went on before and after Terry and Paul changed their lives for the better. As doctors and patients alike have experienced, it sometimes is possible to fix the unfixable.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: While following leads on a Nazi escape network, the teams in Southern Spain and Northern Argentina both make discoveries of vast tunnel systems in the mountains.

programme.desc: Host Bobby Bognar crisscrosses the country to reveal whats behind a pancake breakfast. He gets fresh with a cow in a quest to learn if there really is butter in buttermilk pancakes.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: When Krakatoa blew, it was one of the loudest explosions in history. Explore the forces that led to this extraordinary event and the devastation that the volcano caused.

programme.title: Rome: Rise And Fall Of An Empire
programme.desc: A look at the demise of the Roman Empire. Despite efforts from the last Emperor, the Romans become outnumbered by foreign invaders.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: Peter meets with a man who warns of the deathly risks of searching for Yamashitas treasure, and a connection to the CIA, as the team moves mountains to clear the last obstacles and finds a secret tunnel directly into the mountain.

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: From the riddles of the Sphinx to mummification and the pyramids, Egypt has seen some of the highest-profile archaeological finds in history. But with so many contenders, which secret has had the biggest impact on our view of Ancient Egypt?

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: While the Bermuda Triangle is a well-known area of strange phenomenon in the Atlantic, there is another, more treacherous triangle in the Pacific off the coast of Japan known as the "Dragons Triangle".

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: Recent sightings around Alaska match native stories of a vicious Arctic mermaid that attacks unsuspecting people. With only five per cent of the worlds oceans explored, could a sinister mermaid be among the oceans undocumented creatures?

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: In 1565, the Knights of Saint John defended Malta from attacking Ottomans. Terry Schappert reveals what it was like to be a warrior in one of historys greatest sieges.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: The team triggers a possible water trap in the cave and are forced to stop digging. Martin Flagg believes the Story Rock indicates a tunnel behind a waterfall and the team brings in a Navy diver to explore the plunge pools and search for an entrance.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: How an urban legend came true during the 1930s when swarms of alligators were discovered to be living underneath the busy streets of New York City. Modern herpetologists and explorers search for alligators in the sewers of the city today.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Today, New York is the biggest city in the country but its got some dark secrets in its past. Uncover the secret societies that built New York - from the underground up.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: Some of the worlds leading physicists believe they have found evidence proving the existence of parallel universes.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Russia is the home of cosmism, a belief that human civilisation originated in the cosmos and is destined to return to space. But many believe the rise of communism led to a wall of secrecy surrounding extraterrestrial contact in Russia.

programme.title: Battles BC
programme.desc: Discover how, after years of rivalry, a small Greek army defeated the Persians through sheer mettle and a brilliant defensive strategy.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: The team join the hunt for lost footage of a D-Day secret mission. Plus, can they find one of The Beatles, George Harrisons, most famous guitars?

programme.title: Lost Relics Of The Knights Templar
programme.desc: Episode four centres on the Libation vessel. Exquisitely shaped from marble, its Carl’s favourite piece from the hoard and in pristine condition; adorned with four carved heads.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: When the team hits more wood deep in the Money Pit area where GPR results detected what could be an offset chamber, the Fellowship is more convinced than ever that their search for answers is about to payoff.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: The American frontier is full of legends of cowboys, Native Americans, and outlaws. But there are also many eerie stories of cursed mountains, monsters and even UFOs. Could these tales be true? Is the Wild West much stranger than commonly thought?

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum rise from the ashes and start anew in Phoenix, Arizona. Along the way, Rick check out rare vintage Americana items, Chum checks out a mid-century furniture collection, and Corey gets in the ring for some boxing memorabilia.

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum journey to St. Paul, Minnesota, where they unearth an impressive trilobite fossil collection. Then, Rick grows a heart for a first edition "Tin Woodman of Oz" book, and Chum offers his two cents on an ancient coin collection.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.desc: Across nearly every continent on Earth we can find similar remarkable stone structures of unexplainable engineering feats. Might the building of these megalithic sites have been directed by an extraterrestrial hand?

programme.title: The UnXplained: Mysteries of the Universe
programme.desc: Humanity has worshipped the Sun since the beginning of time, and yet even with our modern technology, we still know so little about it. Could unlocking the mysteries of the Sun be the difference between life and death for human civilization?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Turtlemania hits the shop when a seller tries to pawn a 1991 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles action figure and prototype. Will Chum say "cowabunga" to the customers asking price or will it be a hard "shell?"

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: The most compelling investigations from Season 2 of Beyond Skinwalker Ranch contain shocking evidence, stunning documentation, crazy experiments, bizarre phenomena, and never-before-seen footage.

programme.title: Curse of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Investigations begin on Skinwalker Ranch, with members of the team confronting a secret that Dr Travis Taylor has had to keep from them for the past two years, before conducting an aerial experiment that reveals shocking and disturbing phenomena.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: After more than a dozen years of searching, the team may have discovered the legendary Chappell Vault.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: In our modern world, we believe technology safeguards us from disasters. But are we truly protected? Are we as vulnerable today as our ancestors were to fires, earthquakes, and hurricanes?

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Back in Las Vegas, the guys are ready to hit the jackpot. With the home field advantage, Chum beams at a lightbulb trick from Vegas own Mr. Electric, while Rick kneels on a stool from Queen Elizabeth IIs coronation.

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: In this episode, Corey, Chum, and Rick are back in Vegas and unpacking all the treasures they found on the road and revealing some never-before-seen items. From belt buckles in Texas, to sleek yachts in Seattle, and 18th century pistols.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Are reports of a strange swirling vortex with a brilliant white center in the skies over Oklahoma proof of a genuine UFO? Does a video claimed to be discovered sealed in Vatican archives, show a real case of demonic possession?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A German American pilot, Dieter Dengler, uses survival skills honed as a child to escape a secret prison in Laos in the early years of the Vietnam war.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A lifelong escape artist, Forrest Tucker, ends up in San Quentin prison; despite his advanced age, he manages to engineer one of the most audacious prison breaks of all time.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Humanity has been fascinated by the notion that man will one day travel through time. But what if time travel has already taken place? People may have managed to journey through the fabric of time, whether by design... or perhaps, by accident?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Ultimate Evidence
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos draws on evidence from past series as he takes an in-depth look at the mystery of Southern Perus Nasca Lines.

programme.desc: The team launches an incredible nighttime 200-drone light show experiment above the Triangle and the East Field, leading to a startling sighting in the sky and new data that points toward possible answers deep inside the mysterious Mesa.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: While the team continues to hunt down the legendary Chappell Vault in the Money Pit, new structures are uncovered in the mysterious swamp that strengthen a developing theory.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: All over the world, there are giant monoliths that our ancestors carved out of solid rock. What was the purpose of these monuments? Did they serve some kind of ritual function? Were they intended to honour the gods? Or designed to conduct energy?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick heads east to test a rare weapon from the 18th century. Back at the shop, Corey takes a swing at a Mickey Mantle rookie card. Then, military expert Alex brews something special for Ricks eyes only.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey bets it all on an original Triple Crown Trophy, lets see if he can win this horse race. Next the guys call in Rick Dale to save what might be one of the very first rides from Coney Island.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Things get scary when a seller comes in with a letter from Stephen King. Will all work and no play make Corey a dull boy? Corey pays lip service to a Harrison family tradition when a James Bond poster comes in. Does he spy a deal?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It’s one of the most infamous and unsolved mob murders--notorious mobster Bugsy Siegel is gunned down in his Beverly Hills living room. Bugsy Siegel made a lot of enemies across the country, but who killed him, and why?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Rising from the sands of the Egyptian desert is one of the ancient world’s greatest wonders--the mighty Sphinx. This mythological creature, with the head of a human and the body of a lion, looks like it’s standing guard at the great pyramids of Giza.

programme.title: Greatest Heists With Pierce Brosnan
programme.desc: Two thieves dressed as fake cops make off with a half-billion dollars worth of world-class artwork from a Boston museum. Although the paintings are still missing, numerous suspects turn up dead.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick swings for the fences on some major league memorabilia from one of baseballs best. Corey and Chum go to the end of the road authenticating a Boyz II Men jacket. Chum is starstruck by some unique items from the golden age of Hollywood.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: While the team continues to hunt down the legendary Chappell Vault in the Money Pit, new structures are uncovered in the mysterious swamp that strengthen a developing theory.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: All over the world, there are giant monoliths that our ancestors carved out of solid rock. What was the purpose of these monuments? Did they serve some kind of ritual function? Were they intended to honour the gods? Or designed to conduct energy?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick heads east to test a rare weapon from the 18th century. Back at the shop, Corey takes a swing at a Mickey Mantle rookie card. Then, military expert Alex brews something special for Ricks eyes only.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is dancing to the music from the radio in his kitchen when he hears some noise outside, and wonders what the difference is and how you make music. So he goes to Okido to find out with his friends. In Okido, Zoe is playing a ukulele and Felix is playing a recorder and they are trying to make music, but they’re not very good yet, and neither is Messy when he tries! They see the Cloudship arrive and go in to see Zim, Zam and Zoom. “The Musicbots have a bad case of rhythm-rust!” declares Zam.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When Apple feels left out of a Berryball game and an advanced ballet class, she invents some “groove booties” programmed to dance to any beat. She temporarily impresses her friends with her dance moves, but when the groove booties go out of control and threaten the towns Berryball game, she is forced to fess up.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Sam uses Harrys bucket to collect drips from a leak in the house Harry rushes to Dino-World to save the dinos from drowning.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: At his schools Show and Tell, Harrys dinosaurs are branded as old-fashioned in comparison to one of the other kids hi-tech Dino-Robot.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: After an Asian palm civet steals Hero’s food, the Junior Rangers set off to bring the civet back to where it belongs. The trip takes them to the rainforest, a durian plantation and a run-in with a wild boar!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Diesel is not a very helpful engine, but at Christmas, when there is so much extra work to be done, his unhelpfulness is really unwelcome and unkind, especially when he refuses to stop for Paxton who has been derailed. Thomas decides to help Diesel see the error of his ways. Over the course of the next few days Diesel is visited by what appear to be ‘ghostly engines’ who remind him just how unhelpful he has been in the past, the joy helping others can bring at Christmas and the danger that if you don’t help others they might not come to help you when you really need them. When Diesel becomes derailed himself and fears that he could be abandoned the message finally hits home.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Den and Dart are a team and the best of friends. They work together at the Dieselworks and are rarely separated. But when Mavis has an accident and is sent for repair the Fat Controller needs a replacement engine to work at the quarry. He decides to send Den who is very worried about taking on a new job on his own, especially when Mavis warns him about how troublesome the trucks can be. Dart isn’t too happy about working on his own at the quarry either, but with the help from new friends both Den and Dart manage to cope with being separated.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Doctor Natureza needs help to clean up the ocean. Indeed, a large sheet of plastic floats on the water and endangers the flora and fauna. Grisu, accompanied by Stella, boards the « laboratory boat » to help Doctor Natureza vacuum up the waste with the machine she has developed. But throughout the process, Grisu burns the pumping engine. They cant vacuum the ocean anymore. Fortunately, Grisu has the idea of using all the waste that lies around them and Naturezas bicycle to design a new – and ecological- device that finally allows them to achieve the mission. Because, as firefighter, Grisu never gives up!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Mr. Cornuzzo, a journalist, comes to Dragontown to check whether Stella’s school blog articles about Grisu are true. He quickly comes to the conclusion that what Stella invented everything, and she is actually a liar. To his eyes, Grisù is nothing more than a tiny lizard!Driven by his friendship for Stella, Grisu tries to do his best to prove Cornuzzo that there are dragons in Dragontown. However, acting like a dragon is none of Grisù’s best skills.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is fascinated that his friend Little Grey Squirrel is going to stay in his dray all Winter long. He and Little Field Mouse decide to hibernate in the hollow log until Spring, but soon become bored and fidgety. Little Field Mouse gives up and plays in the snow. Will Little Nutbrown Hare manage to stay inside, or will he be tempted out as well?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After a long quiet winter in the meadow Little Nutbrown hare announces that he can’t wait for winter to be over so he can enjoy the other seasons with their special treats to see, hear and taste. Will the sound of icicles tinkling in the wind, the taste of a frozen Winter berry and some very unusual tracks in the snow convince the little hare that Winter is just as special as the other seasons?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy is desperately trying to do do something that requires calm and concentration but his intrusive family make it impossible. The more he tries to be on his own, the less the others leave him alone as they are very curious to find out what he is up to…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are building a new aquarium at the sea life center for a baby tiger shark. Scoop is excited, imagining the shark will be like a pet puppy. Leo is less than enthused, barely concealing his fear of sharks. When the shark is collected at the docks and placed in a holding tank inside Muck’s tray, Scoop convinces Muck they should take “Stripy” the shark “for a walk” around the neighbourhood. After introducing her to Pilchard, and pointing out the mayor’s office (startling Mr Bentley!), they see JJ and Saffi on the playing field, teaching Cooper some pet tricks. Determined to teach Stripy some tricks too, Scoop and Muck begin a game of fetch... which ends up with Muck getting his front bucket stuck between two trees. Back at the sea life centre, Bob is concerned. If the shark doesn’t arrive soon, she will miss her feeding time.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the gang are building an Automatic Car Wash for Curtis’s Garage, but Roley is being as obsessive as ever, checking and re-checking that the newly laid tarmac is absolutely, completely flat. Just as Roley gives Bob the all clear to start building, Mayor Madison and Mr. Bentley arrive in Phillip expecting to use the car wash! Wendy explains they’ve been held up – but to come back later. Once the car wash is ready, Wendy explains how the control console works and does a ‘test run’. It works perfectly and at last Curtis can re-open his garage. Roley, however, is still not convinced the tarmac is flat. To re-assure him Bob tells Leo to do one more test run. As the run starts, Roley thinks he sees some un-flattened tarmac and rushes into the car wash to flatten it!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Mr. Rabbit makes up coupons for free cookies to celebrate the grand opening of his cookie shop and gives them to his young son to drop in the mailbox outside. After chasing down the clues from the mail carrier to the post office and back again, Huckle determines that Jr Rabbit mistakenly dropped the coupons into the trash container beside the mail box. /A model boat is mysteriously broken and Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to discover how it happened.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo spots a white-bellied sea eagle while flying his kite. Understanding that the sea eagle doesn’t belong in their garden, the Junior Rangers take the sea eagle to a lake where it can find food—and its partner!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A honey bee drops in on Leo’s picnic. The Junior Rangers buzz down to the forest to guide the honey bee back to its beehive, but an encounter with some wasps could prove too much for the Junior Rangers to handle.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: It’s Christmas eve and big snow flakes are falling from the sky. Simon is afraid that Santa Claus won’t be able to drive his sled in this weather. So once he’s in bed, Simon wakes up his little brother Gaspard: they’re going to help Santa Claus land his sleigh by making a landing strip in the yard, with strings of lights. The next morning there are piles of presents under the Christmas Tree. Thank-you who? Thank-you Simon!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a sunny autumn day, Berry and Dolly went into to forest to pick blueberries. Flutter, the butterfly girl, and Eddy, the potato beetle joined them as well. When Eddy saw the fruitful bushes can’t help but pick all the best fruits before the others. What’s left to do?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.desc: On a summer afternoon after a heavy storm Leapy, the grasshopper found an injured stranger, He immediately called for help. Berry and Dolly arrived in no time as always.

programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed.
